intro: Habenella curvilabra, commonly known as the spiral fern, is a unique species of fern characterized by its distinctive, twisting fronds. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its fronds exhibit a helical growth pattern, which gives it its common name. The leaves are usually narrow and have a leathery texture, contributing to its ornamental value.
